intro: Delissea angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved delissea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small yellow flowers arranged in a compact inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions. It is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to withstand coastal winds and salt spray. Delissea angustifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
